tweets.text: @AaronBell4NUL I fear we are at a tipping point and unless @RedIndustries2, @ClareDinnisEA and @EnvAgencyMids get a grip, the situation will deteriorate. I don't get the impression there will be any illegal direct action but people have had enough of being ignored by official agencies.
@awjre @BATHNESHighways @ccbathnes @CanalRiverTrust @WaterSpaceBath @EnvAgencySW @paulncrossley @WalkRideBath @cana @Wheels4Well @CrippledCyclist @scope They reinstated what was there previously!

A locked post here would have been a much better solution.

@awjre @BATHNESHighways @ccbathnes @CanalRiverTrust @WaterSpaceBath @EnvAgencySW @paulncrossley @WalkRideBath @cana @Wheels4Well @CrippledCyclist @scope You messaged me in the past expressing concern about parked cars blocking this route!!Joanna Wright was involved in discussions with the CRT to get the barrier reinstated.

tweets.text:
Dredging on the Steeping River resumed today.

It‚Äôs the final part of de-silting, re-joining the rivers near Haven House.

Work is expected to end 27 March. That'll mark the end of phase one of Steeping partners‚Äô dredging plans to reduce flood risk, which started last September. https://t.co/kMIwWHgIOh

@alison_born @BATHNESHighways @ccbathnes @CanalRiverTrust @WaterSpaceBath @EnvAgencySW @paulncrossley @WalkRideBath @cana @Wheels4Well Can submit @CrippledCyclist excellent FOI & get barrier removed. Council should not be creating these issues in the first place. This is a major wheeled user route into the city. We need to tackle the social model of disability not make it worse HT @scope  https://t.co/AKf51rqyWJ https://t.co/C6CotB5Y9H

@mrlewismitchell @whiteroseforest @Broughton_Hall @DefraGovUK @ForestryComm @EnvAgency Unlikely. And they look to be planted at metre spacing, so yes, 80-90% losses would improve it from an over-dense plantation of bean stalks to more natural spacing suited to good wildlife habitat üëç

I have campaigned with @AireIncinerator to üõë#Keighley Incinerator but only avenue now available is Judicial Review which is expensive. 

I asked Justice Sec @RobertBuckland what more can be done to make JRs more accessible so public bodies like @EnvAgency can be held to account. https://t.co/yc2zFWqIay

tweets.text: One highlight of my week was attending our Fatigue Network‚Äôs 5th birthday. Not all workplaces have a Fatigue Network. I‚Äôm proud @EnvAgency does - its 300+ members do an incredible job raising awareness and supporting colleagues to make sure they are not defined by their condition https://t.co/Vwt4sVSefJ
@Lophophanes @mrlewismitchell @whiteroseforest @Broughton_Hall @DefraGovUK @ForestryComm @EnvAgency Incorrect thinning and coppicing can benefit biodiversity and produce   timber

Looking forward to talking with sixth form students at my local @GreenheadCol @gccareersdept today about stepping into environmental careers! I'll be sharing my advice based on a varied career in #natureconservation #waterindustry #consultancy and @EnvAgency! #dowhatyoulove https://t.co/pcGyZf1etb

urls.description: Environment Agency Chief Executive Sir James Bevan warned government and business on Tuesday (16 March) that we need climate adaptation measures as well as net zero ambitions, describing them as ‚Äútwo sides of the same coin‚Äù.

The mixed grass is the best way to stop further erosion as long as it‚Äôs maintained Lindsey marsh are doing our maintenance this year @nextotheheart1

@EnvAgencyMids @wmcidb @LincolnshireCC @EastLindseyDC @NFUEastMidlands @W4IDB @robertcaudwell @WendyBowkett Dredging!? Just silt removal. And now Reed planting #sigh do the reeds slow the flow and block the outflows? Grateful for our improvements of course, but hate those reeds

tweets.text:
@mrlewismitchell @whiteroseforest @Broughton_Hall @DefraGovUK @ForestryComm @EnvAgency In theory, yes. In practice, no (& ditto tube removal - it hardly ever actually gets done).

Remember woodlands for wildlife need sunny glades, and patches of dense ground flora. That doesn't happen with thinning. You need wide, but most importantly, irregular, tree spacing.

@AliDriverUK @whiteroseforest @Broughton_Hall @DefraGovUK @ForestryComm @EnvAgency I've planted quite a few trees over the years, and never used a single tube; ALL the losses have been due to human interference, none to browsing. Tubes attract human interference, not discourage it . . .

@Lophophanes @whiteroseforest @Broughton_Hall @DefraGovUK @ForestryComm @EnvAgency Sadly that would result in failure of a large % of the planted trees and thus failure to meet requirements of the funding scheme because the grazing pressure from deer, rabbits, hares and voles is huge. 1.2 metre tubes removed and recycled after 5 yrs are the only option here.

The coarse fish #CloseSeason starts today, meaning it‚Äôs illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15 June inclusive.  

We spoke to Fisheries Officer Matt Buck to find out why the close season is so important üëá

More info: https://t.co/u6IhTpkgUB #Angling https://t.co/wVVj0shIow
